http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/tickets/280265-official-members-ticket-sale-update

Main Official Members’ ticket sale – November 14-16
The process for selling tickets for this sale will remain the same. With over 120,000 official LFC Members, supporters are asked for their patience and co-operation in order to make the sales process as smooth as possible.

From 8.15am Tuesday 14th November: Members who recorded a minimum of 13 games wishing to purchase tickets for the following fixtures:

Manchester City; Tottenham Hotspur; West Ham United; Newcastle United; Watford; AFC Bournemouth; Stoke City; Brighton & Hove Albion

Members eligible to purchase tickets during this sale are guaranteed a ticket for each match.



From 8.15am Wednesday 15th November: Members who recorded a minimum of 4 games wishing to purchase tickets for the following fixtures:

Manchester City; Tottenham Hotspur; Brighton & Hove Albion

Tickets for this sale will be sold strictly on a first come first served basis subject to availability, and we cannot guarantee that tickets will be available to all that apply.



From 8.15am Thursday 16th November: ALL Members wishing to purchase tickets for the following games:

West Ham United; Newcastle United; Watford; AFC Bournemouth; Stoke City

Tickets for this sale will be sold strictly on a first come first served basis subject to availability, and we cannot guarantee that tickets will be available to all that apply.

Moreno: “I’m happier now things are going well for me & I’d say so far this has been a decent season for me, if not the best in my career.”

Moreno: “I’m nearly at my best, but none of this comes without very hard work - the hard work in pre-season and the battling to get back.”

Moreno: “All is due to my desire to be at Liverpool, one of the best clubs in the world. Playing well leads to happiness on/off the field.”

Moreno: “I live for Liverpool. I love Liverpool. I always want to win when I’m wearing the shirt of Liverpool.”

BREAKING: Emre Can is almost certain to leave Liverpool next summer. (Dominic King)

For all the discussions that have taken place with Can it has reached the point where there appears to be no solution. (Dominic King)

Liverpool have refused to agree to a release clause and will not make any special dispensation in this case for Can. (Dominic King)

Can will be able to start negotiating with clubs on the continent in 58 days about signing a pre-contract. (Dominic King)

The biggest concern for Liverpool, however, is they are now likely to lose a multi-million asset without recouping a penny. (Dominic King)

For the moment, Can's priority is helping Liverpool reach the knockout stages of the Champions League. (Dominic King)

While it is unlikely Wijnaldum will play against West Ham on Saturday, he is not on crutches & is awaiting results of a scan. (Dominic King)

Emre Can set to leave Liverpool for free next summer as new contract talks reach deadlock, writes @DominicKing_DM

Southgate on Sturridge: "He’s not playing regularly. I think it’s very difficult. I don’t remember the last time Daniel had 90 minutes."

Southgate: "So again, to come into games like we’re playing, and be able to be at his very best, is very difficult."

Southgate on Ox: "He suffers slightly from the change of system because the way we want to go, he becomes a possibility at wing-back."

Southgate: "If we play him as one of the players just off the forwards, we’ve got Alli, we’ve got Rashford, we’ve got Sterling."
Emre Can out, Naby Keita in next summer it seems then.

Moreno: “I’m happier now things are going well for me & I’d say so far this has been a decent season for me, if not the best in my career.”

Moreno: “I’m nearly at my best, but none of this comes without very hard work - the hard work in pre-season and the battling to get back.”

Moreno: “All is due to my desire to be at Liverpool, one of the best clubs in the world. Playing well leads to happiness on/off the field.”

Moreno: “I live for Liverpool. I love Liverpool. I always want to win when I’m wearing the shirt of Liverpool.”

Klopp on Clyne: “You cannot rush it. He’s here. He was in a good way, running with high intensity. But the muscle showed a little reaction.“

Klopp: “That was not an injury, and usually with a healthy and fit player you wouldn’t even think about it.“

Klopp: “But in his case because it was a little sign again from the back, we took him out and it’s a few steps back again.”

Klopp: “Joe and Trent have done really well. They have improved a lot, both in different games. That’s why we don’t have pressure on Clyne.”

Dejan Lovren has been given strong support by his manager, Jürgen Klopp, and West Ham’s Slaven Bilic after receiving death threats.

Klopp on Lovren voted POTM: “It only shows how fans are different from people who are very loud on social media. That’s how I see it.“

Klopp: ”In the more difficult moments you have to really show togetherness and I could not imagine the fans would react that quick.”

Klopp on Lovren voted POTM: “I really like the fact they did it, that our fans showed: ‘No, that’s not the truth.’ Yes, we make mistakes.“

Klopp: ”Dejan made a mistake or two in a game but that’s not a problem, we still can show togetherness. That’s how it is.”

Klopp on social media: “I tell the boys, don’t read it. The criticism about the game, that’s our opinion, no other opinion is important.“

Klopp: ”That does not mean I am always 100% right, it’s just that it’s the only important one.”

Klopp: ”I have no problem with information but we all have to learn to judge it right.”

Carragher: “Of all the transfers last summer, none has had more impact than Liverpool’s Mohamed Salah.”

Carragher: “When I saw Salah score his first at Watford on the opening day, I felt this was a player who would score 15 this season.“

Carragher: ”I underestimated. He is on schedule to get 25.”

Carragher on Salah: “There has been plenty of criticism of Liverpool’s recruitment in recent years – much of it deserved.“

Carragher: ”But just as with the signing of Mané in 2016, they have spent very well in bringing Salah back to England.”

Carragher on Salah: “Paying over £35m seemed risky, but as was the case with Mané, Salah already looks to be worth more than he cost.”
